resources.string: LM AudioSpy
Double tap screen to start recording
Double tap screen to stop recording
RECORDING

This mode allows you to record audio while your eyes are off the screen. Record audio by double tapping on screen. Double tap again to stop and save. The back button is disabled and the app will try to relaunch the current view when it loses focus by e.g. pressing HOME button, keeping the app available for double taps.
Start recording audio right away. This app will not attempt to lock on screen. You may do anything in your device wile recording. Hit STOP button to stop and save.
Set a new save directory where new recordings will be saved.
View all saved recordings. Choose what you want to do with a recording.
Set to higher value if volume of recording is too low. Set to lower if it is too loud.
Choose WAV only if you want raw audio in WAV format. Choose M4A only if you want encoded audio that is supported by most media players. Choose WAV and M4A if you want both.
Set parameters to different value if default values are not supported by this device.
Send recording to others via email or other apps.

Choose the output format to save the recordings to:

WAV and M4A
Amount of samples of audio data to record by this device per second. Most devices support 44100 Hz.
Configures the number of channels to record audio. Setting it to mono will likely work.
The data size of individual audio samples recorded per second.
Total size of output audio per time of playback after encoding recorded samples. This setting is used when converting audio to M4A format.
